deit-b/16.quote: Training model_10: Dataset: Cassava 2020 only, deit-b16 + img_size = 384 + augmentations + bi-tempered logistic loss (t1=0.8, t2=1.4)

efficientnet-b4.quote: model_13 (efn-b4-cmix)... efn-b4 + img_size = 512 + augmentations + bi-tempered logistic loss (t1=0.8, t2=1.4) + cutmix

freeze-non-classifier-layers.quote: Training model_13_ft_2: Dataset: Cassava 2019 + 2020 merged dataset, finetune model_13 with: freeze non-classifier layers + bi-tempered logistic loss (t1=0.8, t2=1.4) + cutmix

bi-tempered-logistic-loss.quote: vit-b16 + img_size = 384 + augmentations + bi-tempered logistic loss (t1=0.8, t2=1.4)... efn-b4 + img_size = 512 + augmentations + bi-tempered logistic loss (t1=0.8, t2=1.4) + cutmix... Proper-parametered bi-tempered logistic loss works better than other losses (like Taylor Cross Entropy loss or Label Smoothing loss) in most cases, no matter training or finetuning.

2019-data.quote: Training model_13_ft_2: Dataset: Cassava 2019 + 2020 merged dataset

2020-data.quote: Training model_8: Dataset: Cassava 2020 only... Training model_13: Dataset: Cassava 2020 only... Cassava 2020 dataset works better than Cassava 2019+2020 merged dataset when training models
